remarks: Define the floor (greatest integer less than or equal to) function.  See ~ flval for its value, ~ fllelt for its basic property, and ~ flcl for its closure.  For example, ` ( |_ `` ( 3 / 2 ) ) = 1 ` while ` ( |_ `` -u ( 3 / 2 ) ) = -u 2 ` ( ~ ex-fl ). The term "floor" was coined by Ken Iverson.  He also invented a mathematical notation for floor, consisting of an L-shaped left bracket and its reflection as a right bracket.  In APL, the left-bracket alone is used, and we borrow this idea.  (Thanks to Paul Chapman for this information.)  (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2004.)
statement:
df-fl $p |- |_ = ( x e. RR |-> ( iota_ y e. ZZ ( y <_ x /\ x < ( y + 1 ) ) ) ) $.
$d x y $.
